availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James C. Burnett (Spencer County, Kentucky, resident and sergeant in Captain Cochran's Company (Spencer County State Guard) (U.S.A.))

body.p: Spencer County, Kentucky, resident and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy Harrison Burnett in Spencer County on January 8, 1852. Father of Grundy Burnett, Samuel Burnett, Sarah Burnett, and Carrie Burnett. Served in Captain Cochran's Company (Spencer County State Guard) (U.S.A.) as sergeant from September 8, 1862 to October 30, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 7, p. 533A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Spencer County Marriages, Film #000482640, p. 314 of 510 microfilm.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 857.
Find A Grave, "James Cunningham Burnett (1829-1904)," Memorial #146808730, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/146808730 (accessed December 7, 2020).
